5214 Section 156. Section 17-78-1104 is renumbered and amended to read:
5216 [17-15-29] 17-78-1104. Easement for utility use -- Realignment at property owner's expense.
5180 (1) As used in this section, "utility easement" means an easement acquired by a county through the use
of eminent domain to provide utility services to the county's residents.
5182 (2) The owner of a servient estate subject to a utility easement may realign the easement at the servient
estate owner's expense unless the alignment cannot be reasonably changed because of engineering
or safety requirements.
5223 Section 157. Section 17-79-101 is renumbered and amended to read:
5187
CHAPTER 79. County Land Use, Development, and Management Act
5188
Part 1. General Provisions
5227 [17-27a-102] 17-79-101. Purposes -- General land use authority -- Limitations.
5191 (1)
(a) The purposes of this chapter are to:
5192 (i) provide for the health, safety, and welfare;
5193 (ii) promote the prosperity;
5194 (iii) improve the morals, peace, good order, comfort, convenience, and aesthetics of each county
and each county's present and future inhabitants and businesses;
5196 (iv) protect the tax base;
5197 (v) secure economy in governmental expenditures;
5198 (vi) foster the state's agricultural and other industries;
5199 (vii) protect both urban and nonurban development;
5200 (viii) protect and ensure access to sunlight for solar energy devices;
- 169 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5201 (ix) provide fundamental fairness in land use regulation;
5202 (x) facilitate orderly growth, allow growth in a variety of housing types, and contribute toward
housing affordability; and
5204 (xi) protect property values.
5205 (b) Subject to Subsection (4) and Section 11-41-103, to accomplish the purposes of this chapter, a
county may enact all ordinances, resolutions, and rules and may enter into other forms of land use
controls and development agreements that the county considers necessary or appropriate for the use
and development of land within the unincorporated area of the county or a designated mountainous
planning district, including ordinances, resolutions, rules, restrictive covenants, easements, and
development agreements governing:
5212 (i) uses;
5213 (ii) density;
5214 (iii) open spaces;
5215 (iv) structures;
5216 (v) buildings;
5217 (vi) energy-efficiency;
5218 (vii) light and air;
5219 (viii) air quality;
5220 (ix) transportation and public or alternative transportation;
5221 (x) infrastructure;
5222 (xi) street and building orientation and width requirements;
5223 (xii) public facilities;
5224 (xiii) fundamental fairness in land use regulation; and
5225 (xiv) considerations of surrounding land uses to balance the foregoing purposes with a landowner's
private property interests and associated statutory and constitutional protections.
5228 (2) Each county shall comply with the mandatory provisions of this part before any agreement or
contract to provide goods, services, or municipal-type services to any storage facility or transfer
facility for high-level nuclear waste, or greater than class C radioactive waste, may be executed or
implemented.
5232 (3)
- 170 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(a) Any ordinance, resolution, or rule enacted by a county [pursuant to its] in accordance with the
county's authority under this chapter shall comply with the state's exclusive jurisdiction to regulate
oil and gas activity, as described in Section 40-6-2.5.
5235 (b) A county may enact an ordinance, resolution, or rule that regulates surface activity incident to an oil
and gas activity if the county demonstrates that the regulation:
5237 (i) is necessary for the purposes of this chapter;
5238 (ii) does not effectively or unduly limit, ban, or prohibit an oil and gas activity; and
5239 (iii) does not interfere with the state's exclusive jurisdiction to regulate oil and gas activity, as described
in Section 40-6-2.5.
5241 (4)
(a) This Subsection (4) applies to development agreements entered into on or after May 5, 2021.
5243 (b) A provision in a county development agreement is unenforceable if the provision requires
an individual or an entity, as a condition for issuing building permits or otherwise regulating
development activities within an unincorporated area of the county, to initiate a process for a
municipality to annex the unincorporated area in accordance with Title 10, Chapter 2, Part 8,
Annexation.
5248 (c) Subsection (4)(b) does not affect or impair the enforceability of any other provision in the
development agreement.
5288 Section 158. Section 17-79-102 is renumbered and amended to read:
5290 [17-27a-103] 17-79-102. Definitions.
As used in this chapter:
5254 (1) "Accessory dwelling unit" means a habitable living unit added to, created within, or detached from a
primary single-family dwelling and contained on one lot.
5256 (2) "Adversely affected party" means a person other than a land use applicant who:
5257 (a) owns real property adjoining the property that is the subject of a land use application or land use
decision; or
5259 (b) will suffer a damage different in kind than, or an injury distinct from, that of the general community
as a result of the land use decision.
5261 (3) "Affected entity" means a county, municipality, special district, special service district under
Title 17D, Chapter 1, Special Service District Act, school district, interlocal cooperation entity
- 171 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
established under Title 11, Chapter 13, Interlocal Cooperation Act, specified property owner,
property owner's association, public utility, or the Department of Transportation, if:
5266 (a) the entity's services or facilities are likely to require expansion or significant modification because
of an intended use of land;
5268 (b) the entity has filed with the county a copy of the entity's general or long-range plan; or
5270 (c) the entity has filed with the county a request for notice during the same calendar year and before the
county provides notice to an affected entity in compliance with a requirement imposed under this
chapter.
5273 (4) "Affected owner" means the owner of real property that is:
5274 (a) a single project;
5275 (b) the subject of a land use approval that sponsors of a referendum timely challenged in accordance
with Subsection 20A-7-601(6); and
5277 (c) determined to be legally referable under Section 20A-7-602.8.
5278 (5) "Appeal authority" means the person, board, commission, agency, or other body designated by
ordinance to decide an appeal of a decision of a land use application or a variance.
5281 (6) "Billboard" means a freestanding ground sign located on industrial, commercial, or residential
property if the sign is designed or intended to direct attention to a business, product, or service that
is not sold, offered, or existing on the property where the sign is located.
5285 (7) "Building code adoption cycle" means the period of time beginning the day on which a specific
edition of a construction code from a nationally recognized code authority is adopted and effective
in Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act, until the day before a new edition of a
construction code is adopted and effective in Title 15A, State Construction and Fire Codes Act.
5290 (8)
(a) "Boundary adjustment" means an agreement between adjoining property owners to relocate a
common boundary that results in a conveyance of property between the adjoining lots, adjoining
parcels, or adjoining lots and parcels.
5293 (b) "Boundary adjustment" does not mean a modification of a lot or parcel boundary that:
5294 (i) creates an additional lot or parcel; or
5295 (ii) is made by the Department of Transportation.
5296 (9)
- 172 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(a) "Boundary establishment" means an agreement between adjoining property owners to clarify the
location of an ambiguous, uncertain, or disputed common boundary.
5299 (b) "Boundary establishment" does not mean a modification of a lot or parcel boundary that:
5301 (i) creates an additional lot or parcel; or
5302 (ii) is made by the Department of Transportation.
5303 (10)
(a) "Charter school" means:
5304 (i) an operating charter school;
5305 (ii) a charter school applicant that a charter school authorizer approves in accordance with Title
53G, Chapter 5, Part 3, Charter School Authorization; or
5307 (iii) an entity that is working on behalf of a charter school or approved charter applicant to develop
or construct a charter school building.
5309 (b) "Charter school" does not include a therapeutic school.
5310 (11) "Chief executive officer" means the person or body that exercises the executive powers of the
county.
5312 (12) "Conditional use" means a land use that, because of the unique characteristics or potential impact
of the land use on the county, surrounding neighbors, or adjacent land uses, may not be compatible
in some areas or may be compatible only if certain conditions are required that mitigate or eliminate
the detrimental impacts.
5316 (13) "Constitutional taking" means a governmental action that results in a taking of private property so
that compensation to the owner of the property is required by the:
5318 (a) Fifth or Fourteenth Amendment of the Constitution of the United States; or
5319 (b) Utah Constitution, Article I, Section 22.
5320 (14) "Conveyance document" means an instrument that:
5321 (a) meets the definition of "document" in Section 57-1-1; and
5322 (b) meets the requirements of Section 57-1-45.5.
5323 (15) "Conveyance of property" means the transfer of ownership of any portion of real property from one
person to another person.
5325 (16) "County utility easement" means an easement that:
5326 (a) a plat recorded in a county recorder's office described as a county utility easement or otherwise as a
utility easement;
- 173 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5328 (b) is not a protected utility easement or a public utility easement as defined in Section 54-3-27;
5330 (c) the county or the county's affiliated governmental entity owns or creates; and
5331 (d)
(i) either:
5332 (A) no person uses or occupies; or
5333 (B) the county or the county's affiliated governmental entity uses and occupies to provide a utility
service, including sanitary sewer, culinary water, electrical, storm water, or communications or
data lines; or
5336 (ii) a person uses or occupies with or without an authorized franchise or other agreement with the
county.
5338 (17) "Culinary water authority" means the department, agency, or public entity with responsibility to
review and approve the feasibility of the culinary water system and sources for the subject property.
5341 (18) "Department of Transportation" means the entity created in Section 72-1-201.
5342 (19) "Development activity" means:
5343 (a) any construction or expansion of a building, structure, or use that creates additional demand and
need for public facilities;
5345 (b) any change in use of a building or structure that creates additional demand and need for public
facilities; or
5347 (c) any change in the use of land that creates additional demand and need for public facilities.
5349 (20)
(a) "Development agreement" means a written agreement or amendment to a written agreement
between a county and one or more parties that regulates or controls the use or development of a
specific area of land.
5352 (b) "Development agreement" does not include an improvement completion assurance.
5353 (21)
(a) "Disability" means a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits one or more of a
person's major life activities, including a person having a record of such an impairment or being
regarded as having such an impairment.
5356 (b) "Disability" does not include current illegal use of, or addiction to, any federally controlled
substance, as defined in Section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act, 21 U.S.C. Sec. 802.
5359 (22) "Document" means the same as that term is defined in Section 57-1-1.
- 174 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5360 (23) "Educational facility":
5361 (a) means:
5362 (i) a school district's building at which pupils assemble to receive instruction in a program for any
combination of grades from preschool through grade 12, including kindergarten and a program for
children with disabilities;
5365 (ii) a structure or facility:
5366 (A) located on the same property as a building described in Subsection (23)(a)(i); and
5368 (B) used in support of the use of that building; and
5369 (iii) a building to provide office and related space to a school district's administrative personnel; and
5371 (b) does not include:
5372 (i) land or a structure, including land or a structure for inventory storage, equipment storage, food
processing or preparing, vehicle storage or maintenance, or similar use that is:
5375 (A) not located on the same property as a building described in Subsection (23)(a)(i); and
5377 (B) used in support of the purposes of a building described in Subsection (23)(a)(i); or
5379 (ii) a therapeutic school.
5380 (24) "Establishment document" means an instrument that:
5381 (a) meets the definition of "document" in Section 57-1-1; and
5382 (b) meets the requirements of Section 57-1-45.
5383 (25) "Full boundary adjustment" means a boundary adjustment that is not a simple boundary
adjustment.
5385 (26) "Fire authority" means the department, agency, or public entity with responsibility to review and
approve the feasibility of fire protection and suppression services for the subject property.
5388 (27) "Flood plain" means land that:
5389 (a) is within the 100-year flood plain designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency; or
5391 (b) has not been studied or designated by the Federal Emergency Management Agency but presents
a likelihood of experiencing chronic flooding or a catastrophic flood event because the land
has characteristics that are similar to those of a 100-year flood plain designated by the Federal
Emergency Management Agency.
5395 (28) "Gas corporation" has the same meaning as defined in Section 54-2-1.
5396 (29) "General plan" means a document that a county adopts that sets forth general guidelines for
proposed future development of:
- 175 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5398 (a) the unincorporated land within the county; or
5399 (b) for a mountainous planning district, the land within the mountainous planning district.
5401 (30) "Geologic hazard" means:
5402 (a) a surface fault rupture;
5403 (b) shallow groundwater;
5404 (c) liquefaction;
5405 (d) a landslide;
5406 (e) a debris flow;
5407 (f) unstable soil;
5408 (g) a rock fall; or
5409 (h) any other geologic condition that presents a risk:
5410 (i) to life;
5411 (ii) of substantial loss of real property; or
5412 (iii) of substantial damage to real property.
5413 (31) "Home-based microschool" means the same as that term is defined in Section 53G-6-201.
5415 (32) "Hookup fee" means a fee for the installation and inspection of any pipe, line, meter, or
appurtenance to connect to a county water, sewer, storm water, power, or other utility system.
5418 (33)
(a) "Identical plans" means floor plans submitted to a county that:
5419 (i) are submitted within the same building code adoption cycle as floor plans that were previously
approved by the county;
5421 (ii) have no structural differences from floor plans that were previously approved by the county;
and
5423 (iii) describe a building that:
5424 (A) is located on land zoned the same as the land on which the building described in the previously
approved plans is located;
5426 (B) has a substantially identical floor plan to a floor plan previously approved by the county; and
5428 (C) does not require any engineering or analysis beyond a review to confirm the submitted floor plans
are substantially identical to a floor plan previously approved by the county or a review of the site
plan and associated geotechnical reports for the site.
5432
- 176 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(b) "Identical plans" include floor plans that are oriented differently as the floor plan that was
previously approved by the county.
5434 (34) "Impact fee" means a payment of money imposed under Title 11, Chapter 36a, Impact Fees Act.
5436 (35) "Improvement completion assurance" means a surety bond, letter of credit, financial institution
bond, cash, assignment of rights, lien, or other equivalent security required by a county to guaranty
the proper completion of landscaping or an infrastructure improvement required as a condition
precedent to:
5440 (a) recording a subdivision plat; or
5441 (b) development of a commercial, industrial, mixed use, or multifamily project.
5442 (36) "Improvement warranty" means an applicant's unconditional warranty that the applicant's installed
and accepted landscaping or infrastructure improvement:
5444 (a) complies with the county's written standards for design, materials, and workmanship; and
5446 (b) will not fail in any material respect, as a result of poor workmanship or materials, within the
improvement warranty period.
5448 (37) "Improvement warranty period" means a period:
5449 (a) no later than one year after a county's acceptance of required public landscaping; or
5450 (b) no later than one year after a county's acceptance of required infrastructure, unless the county:
5452 (i) determines, based on accepted industry standards and for good cause, that a one-year period would
be inadequate to protect the public health, safety, and welfare; and
5455 (ii) has substantial evidence, on record:
5456 (A) of prior poor performance by the applicant; or
5457 (B) that the area upon which the infrastructure will be constructed contains suspect soil and the county
has not otherwise required the applicant to mitigate the suspect soil.
5460 (38) "Infrastructure improvement" means permanent infrastructure that is essential for the public health
and safety or that:
5462 (a) is required for human consumption; and
5463 (b) an applicant [must] shall install:
5464 (i) in accordance with published installation and inspection specifications for public improvements; and
5466 (ii) as a condition of:
5467 (A) recording a subdivision plat;
5468 (B) obtaining a building permit; or
- 177 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5469 (C) developing a commercial, industrial, mixed use, condominium, or multifamily project.
5471 (39) "Internal lot restriction" means a platted note, platted demarcation, or platted designation that:
5473 (a) runs with the land; and
5474 (b)
(i) creates a restriction that is enclosed within the perimeter of a lot described on the plat; or
5476 (ii) designates a development condition that is enclosed within the perimeter of a lot described on the
plat.
5478 (40) "Interstate pipeline company" means a person or entity engaged in natural gas transportation
subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission under the Natural Gas Act,
15 U.S.C. Sec. 717 et seq.
5481 (41) "Intrastate pipeline company" means a person or entity engaged in natural gas transportation that is
not subject to the jurisdiction of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission under the Natural Gas
Act, 15 U.S.C. Sec. 717 et seq.
5484 (42) "Land use applicant" means a property owner, or the property owner's designee, who submits a
land use application regarding the property owner's land.
5486 (43) "Land use application":
5487 (a) means an application that is:
5488 (i) required by a county; and
5489 (ii) submitted by a land use applicant to obtain a land use decision; and
5490 (b) does not mean an application to enact, amend, or repeal a land use regulation.
5491 (44) "Land use authority" means:
5492 (a) a person, board, commission, agency, or body, including the local legislative body, designated by
the local legislative body to act upon a land use application; or
5494 (b) if the local legislative body has not designated a person, board, commission, agency, or body, the
local legislative body.
5496 (45) "Land use decision" means an administrative decision of a land use authority or appeal authority
regarding:
5498 (a) a land use permit;
5499 (b) a land use application; or
5500 (c) the enforcement of a land use regulation, land use permit, or development agreement.
5501 (46) "Land use permit" means a permit issued by a land use authority.
- 178 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5502 (47) "Land use regulation":
5503 (a) means a legislative decision enacted by ordinance, law, code, map, resolution, engineering or
development standard, specification for public improvement, fee, or rule that governs the use or
development of land;
5506 (b) includes the adoption or amendment of a zoning map or the text of the zoning code; and
5508 (c) does not include:
5509 (i) a land use decision of the legislative body acting as the land use authority, even if the decision is
expressed in a resolution or ordinance; or
5511 (ii) a temporary revision to an engineering specification that does not materially:
5512 (A) increase a land use applicant's cost of development compared to the existing specification; or
5514 (B) impact a land use applicant's use of land.
5515 (48) "Legislative body" means the county legislative body, or for a county that has adopted an
alternative form of government, the body exercising legislative powers.
5517 (49) "Lot" means a tract of land, regardless of any label, that is created by and shown on a subdivision
plat that has been recorded in the office of the county recorder.
5519 (50) "Major transit investment corridor" means public transit service that uses or occupies:
5520 (a) public transit rail right-of-way;
5521 (b) dedicated road right-of-way for the use of public transit, such as bus rapid transit; or
5522 (c) fixed-route bus corridors subject to an interlocal agreement or contract between a municipality or
county and:
5524 (i) a public transit district as defined in Section 17B-2a-802; or
5525 (ii) an eligible political subdivision as defined in Section 59-12-2202.
5526 (51) "Micro-education entity" means the same as that term is defined in Section 53G-6-201.
5527 (52) "Moderate income housing" means housing occupied or reserved for occupancy by households
with a gross household income equal to or less than 80% of the median gross income for households
of the same size in the county in which the housing is located.
5530 (53) "Mountainous planning district" means an area designated by a county legislative body in
accordance with Section [17-27a-901] 17-79-408.
5532 (54) "Nominal fee" means a fee that reasonably reimburses a county only for time spent and expenses
incurred in:
5534 (a) verifying that building plans are identical plans; and
- 179 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5535 (b) reviewing and approving those minor aspects of identical plans that differ from the previously
reviewed and approved building plans.
5537 (55) "Noncomplying structure" means a structure that:
5538 (a) legally existed before the structure's current land use designation; and
5539 (b) because of one or more subsequent land use ordinance changes, does not conform to the setback,
height restrictions, or other regulations, excluding those regulations that govern the use of land.
5542 (56) "Nonconforming use" means a use of land that:
5543 (a) legally existed before the current land use designation;
5544 (b) has been maintained continuously since the time the land use ordinance regulation governing the
land changed; and
5546 (c) because of one or more subsequent land use ordinance changes, does not conform to the regulations
that now govern the use of the land.
5548 (57) "Official map" means a map drawn by county authorities and recorded in the county recorder's
office that:
5550 (a) shows actual and proposed rights-of-way, centerline alignments, and setbacks for highways and
other transportation facilities;
5552 (b) provides a basis for restricting development in designated rights-of-way or between designated
setbacks to allow the government authorities time to purchase or otherwise reserve the land; and
5555 (c) has been adopted as an element of the county's general plan.
5556 (58) "Parcel" means any real property that is not a lot.
5557 (59) "Person" means an individual, corporation, partnership, organization, association, trust,
governmental agency, or any other legal entity.
5559 (60) "Plan for moderate income housing" means a written document adopted by a county legislative
body that includes:
5561 (a) an estimate of the existing supply of moderate income housing located within the county;
5563 (b) an estimate of the need for moderate income housing in the county for the next five years;
5565 (c) a survey of total residential land use;
5566 (d) an evaluation of how existing land uses and zones affect opportunities for moderate income housing;
and
5568 (e) a description of the county's program to encourage an adequate supply of moderate income housing.
5570
- 180 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(61) "Planning advisory area" means a contiguous, geographically defined portion of the unincorporated
area of a county established under this part with planning and zoning functions as exercised through
the planning advisory area planning commission, as provided in this chapter, but with no legal or
political identity separate from the county and no taxing authority.
5575 (62) "Plat" means an instrument subdividing property into lots as depicted on a map or other graphical
representation of lands that a licensed professional land surveyor makes and prepares in accordance
with Section [17-27a-603] 17-79-703 or 57-8-13.
5578 (63) "Potential geologic hazard area" means an area that:
5579 (a) is designated by a Utah Geological Survey map, county geologist map, or other relevant map or
report as needing further study to determine the area's potential for geologic hazard; or
5582 (b) has not been studied by the Utah Geological Survey or a county geologist but presents the potential
of geologic hazard because the area has characteristics similar to those of a designated geologic
hazard area.
5585 (64) "Public agency" means:
5586 (a) the federal government;
5587 (b) the state;
5588 (c) a county, municipality, school district, special district, special service district, or other political
subdivision of the state; or
5590 (d) a charter school.
5591 (65) "Public hearing" means a hearing at which members of the public are provided a reasonable
opportunity to comment on the subject of the hearing.
5593 (66) "Public meeting" means a meeting that is required to be open to the public under Title 52, Chapter
4, Open and Public Meetings Act.
5595 (67) "Public street" means a public right-of-way, including a public highway, public avenue, public
boulevard, public parkway, public road, public lane, public alley, public viaduct, public subway,
public tunnel, public bridge, public byway, other public transportation easement, or other public
way.
5599 (68) "Receiving zone" means an unincorporated area that a county designates, by ordinance, as an area
in which an owner of land may receive a transferable development right.
5602 (69) "Record of survey map" means a map of a survey of land prepared in accordance with Section
[17-23-17] 17-73-504.
- 181 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5604 (70) "Residential facility for persons with a disability" means a residence:
5605 (a) in which more than one person with a disability resides; and
5606 (b) which is licensed or certified by the Department of Health and Human Services under:
5608 (i) Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 1, Human Services Programs and Facilities; or
5609 (ii) Title 26B, Chapter 2, Part 2, Health Care Facility Licensing and Inspection.
5610 (71) "Residential roadway" means a public local residential road that:
5611 (a) will serve primarily to provide access to adjacent primarily residential areas and property;
5613 (b) is designed to accommodate minimal traffic volumes or vehicular traffic;
5614 (c) is not identified as a supplementary to a collector or other higher system classified street in an
approved municipal street or transportation master plan;
5616 (d) has a posted speed limit of 25 miles per hour or less;
5617 (e) does not have higher traffic volumes resulting from connecting previously separated areas of the
municipal road network;
5619 (f) cannot have a primary access, but can have a secondary access, and does not abut lots intended for
high volume traffic or community centers, including schools, recreation centers, sports complexes,
or libraries; and
5622 (g) primarily serves traffic within a neighborhood or limited residential area and is not necessarily
continuous through several residential areas.
5624 (72) "Rules of order and procedure" means a set of rules that govern and prescribe in a public meeting:
5626 (a) parliamentary order and procedure;
5627 (b) ethical behavior; and
5628 (c) civil discourse.
5629 (73) "Sanitary sewer authority" means the department, agency, or public entity with responsibility to
review and approve the feasibility of sanitary sewer services or onsite wastewater systems.
5632 (74) "Sending zone" means an unincorporated area that a county designates, by ordinance, as an area
from which an owner of land may transfer a transferable development right.
5634 (75) "Simple boundary adjustment" means a boundary adjustment that does not:
5635 (a) affect a public right-of-way, county utility easement, or other public property;
5636 (b) affect an existing easement, onsite wastewater system, or an internal lot restriction; or
5637 (c) result in a lot or parcel out of conformity with land use regulations.
5638
- 182 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(76) "Site plan" means a document or map that may be required by a county during a preliminary
review [preceding] before the issuance of a building permit to demonstrate that an owner's or
developer's proposed development activity meets a land use requirement.
5642 (77)
(a) "Special district" means an entity under Title 17B, Limited Purpose Local Government Entities -
Special Districts.
5644 (b) "Special district" includes a governmental or quasi-governmental entity that is not a county,
municipality, school district, or the state.
5646 (78) "Specified public agency" means:
5647 (a) the state;
5648 (b) a school district; or
5649 (c) a charter school.
5650 (79) "Specified public utility" means an electrical corporation, gas corporation, or telephone
corporation, as those terms are defined in Section 54-2-1.
5652 (80) "State" includes any department, division, or agency of the state.
5653 (81)
(a) "Subdivision" means any land that is divided, resubdivided, or proposed to be divided into two or
more lots or other division of land for the purpose, whether immediate or future, for offer, sale,
lease, or development either on the installment plan or upon any and all other plans, terms, and
conditions.
5657 (b) "Subdivision" includes:
5658 (i) the division or development of land, whether by deed, metes and bounds description, devise and
testacy, map, plat, or other recorded instrument, regardless of whether the division includes all or a
portion of a parcel or lot; and
5661 (ii) except as provided in Subsection (81)(c), divisions of land for residential and nonresidential uses,
including land used or to be used for commercial, agricultural, and industrial purposes.
5664 (c) "Subdivision" does not include:
5665 (i) a bona fide division or partition of agricultural land for agricultural purposes;
5666 (ii) a recorded conveyance document:
5667 (A) consolidating multiple lots or parcels into one legal description encompassing all lots by reference
to a recorded plat and all parcels by metes and bounds description; or
- 183 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5670 (B) joining a lot to a parcel;
5671 (iii) a bona fide division or partition of land in a county other than a first class county for the purpose of
siting, on one or more of the resulting separate parcels:
5673 (A) an electrical transmission line or a substation;
5674 (B) a natural gas pipeline or a regulation station; or
5675 (C) an unmanned telecommunications, microwave, fiber optic, electrical, or other utility service
regeneration, transformation, retransmission, or amplification facility;
5678 (iv) a bona fide division of land by deed or other instrument if the deed or other instrument states in
writing that the division:
5680 (A) is in anticipation of future land use approvals on the parcel or parcels;
5681 (B) does not confer any land use approvals; and
5682 (C) has not been approved by the land use authority;
5683 (v) a boundary adjustment;
5684 (vi) a boundary establishment;
5685 (vii) a road, street, or highway dedication plat;
5686 (viii) a deed or easement for a road, street, or highway purpose; or
5687 (ix) any other division of land authorized by law.
5688 (82)
(a) "Subdivision amendment" means an amendment to a recorded subdivision in accordance with
Section [17-27a-608] 17-79-711 that:
5690 (i) vacates all or a portion of the subdivision;
5691 (ii) increases the number of lots within the subdivision;
5692 (iii) alters a public right-of-way, a public easement, or public infrastructure within the subdivision;
or
5694 (iv) alters a common area or other common amenity within the subdivision.
5695 (b) "Subdivision amendment" does not include a simple boundary adjustment.
5696 (83) "Substantial evidence" means evidence that:
5697 (a) is beyond a scintilla; and
5698 (b) a reasonable mind would accept as adequate to support a conclusion.
5699 (84) "Suspect soil" means soil that has:
5700
- 184 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(a) a high susceptibility for volumetric change, typically clay rich, having more than a 3% swell
potential;
5702 (b) bedrock units with high shrink or swell susceptibility; or
5703 (c) gypsiferous silt and clay, gypsum, or bedrock units containing abundant gypsum commonly
associated with dissolution and collapse features.
5705 (85) "Therapeutic school" means a residential group living facility:
5706 (a) for four or more individuals who are not related to:
5707 (i) the owner of the facility; or
5708 (ii) the primary service provider of the facility;
5709 (b) that serves students who have a history of failing to function:
5710 (i) at home;
5711 (ii) in a public school; or
5712 (iii) in a nonresidential private school; and
5713 (c) that offers:
5714 (i) room and board; and
5715 (ii) an academic education integrated with:
5716 (A) specialized structure and supervision; or
5717 (B) services or treatment related to a disability, an emotional development, a behavioral development, a
familial development, or a social development.
5719 (86) "Transferable development right" means a right to develop and use land that originates by an
ordinance that authorizes a land owner in a designated sending zone to transfer land use rights from
a designated sending zone to a designated receiving zone.
5722 (87) "Unincorporated" means the area outside of the incorporated area of a municipality.
5723 (88) "Water interest" means any right to the beneficial use of water, including:
5724 (a) each of the rights listed in Section 73-1-11; and
5725 (b) an ownership interest in the right to the beneficial use of water represented by:
5726 (i) a contract; or
5727 (ii) a share in a water company, as defined in Section 73-3-3.5.
5728 (89) "Zoning map" means a map, adopted as part of a land use ordinance, that depicts land use zones,
overlays, or districts.
5768 Section 159. Section 17-79-103 is renumbered and amended to read:

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5770 [17-27a-104] 17-79-103. County standards.
5733 (1) This chapter does not prohibit a county from adopting the county's own land use standards.
5735 (2) Notwithstanding Subsection (1), a county may not impose a requirement, regulation, condition, or
standard that conflicts with a provision of this chapter, Chapter 80, Counties and Housing Supply,
other state law, or federal law.

5779 [17-27a-201] 17-79-201. Required notice.

5783 Section 161. Section 17-79-202 is renumbered and amended to read:
5785 [17-27a-202] 17-79-202. Applicant notice -- Waiver of requirements.
5749 (1) For each land use application, the county shall:
5750 (a) notify the applicant of the date, time, and place of each public hearing and public meeting to
consider the application;
5752 (b) provide to each applicant a copy of each staff report regarding the applicant or the pending
application at least three business days before the public hearing or public meeting; and
5755 (c) notify the applicant of any final action on a pending application.
5756 (2) If a county fails to comply with the requirements of Subsection (1)(a) or (b) or both, an applicant
may waive the failure so that the application may stay on the public hearing or public meeting
agenda and be considered as if the requirements had been met.

5809 (1) Each county shall give:

calendar days before the day of the public hearing.

hours.
5835 (5)
- 188 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
(a) A county shall send a courtesy notice to each owner of private real property whose property is
located entirely or partially within the proposed zoning map enactment or amendment at least 10
days before the scheduled day of the public hearing.
5839 (b) The notice shall:
5840 (i) identify with specificity each owner of record of real property that will be affected by the proposed
zoning map or map amendments;
5842 (ii) state the current zone in which the real property is located;
5843 (iii) state the proposed new zone for the real property;
5844 (iv) provide information regarding or a reference to the proposed regulations, prohibitions, and
permitted uses that the property will be subject to if the zoning map or map amendment is adopted;
5847 (v) state that the owner of real property may no later than 10 days after the day of the first public
hearing file a written objection to the inclusion of the owner's property in the proposed zoning map
or map amendment;
5850 (vi) state the address where the property owner should file the protest;
5851 (vii) notify the property owner that each written objection filed with the county will be provided to the
county legislative body; and
5853 (viii) state the location, date, and time of the public hearing described in Section
[17-27a-502] 17-79-502.

of the notice described in Subsection (2)(b)(i) rather than sent separately.
5859 (6)
(a) A proposed land use ordinance is ministerial in nature if the proposed land use ordinance change is
to:
5861 (i) bring the county's land use ordinances into compliance with a state or federal law;
5862 (ii) adopt a county land use update that affects:
5863 (A) an entire zoning district; or
5864 (B) multiple zoning districts;
5865 (iii) adopt a non-substantive, clerical text amendment to an existing land use ordinance;
5867 (iv) recodify the county's existing land use ordinances; or
5868 (v) designate or define an affected area for purposes of a boundary adjustment or annexation.
- 189 -

SB1007 compared with SB1007S01
5870 (b) A proposed land use ordinance may include more than one of the purposes described in Subsection
(6)(a) and remain ministerial in nature.
5872 (c) If a proposed land use ordinance includes an adoption or modification not described in Subsection
(6)(a):
5874 (i) the proposed land use ordinance is not ministerial in nature, even if the proposed land use ordinance
also includes a change or modification described in Subsection (6)(a); and
5877 (ii) the notice requirements of Subsection (2)(b)(i) apply.

5979 Section 169. Section 17-79-210 is renumbered and amended to read:
5981 [17-27a-210] 17-79-210. Notice to county when a private institution of higher education is

5956 (3) At the request of a county or municipality that is entitled to notice under this section, the institution
and the legislative body of the affected county or municipality shall jointly hold a public hearing to
provide information to the public and receive input from the public about the proposed construction.

correct information to the county within 30 days of the day on which the information changes.

sign.
